description: Number of walks of length n on square lattice, starting at origin, staying on points with x+y >= 0.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,200
A. Bostan, Computer Algebra for Lattice Path Combinatorics, Seminaire de Combinatoire Ph. Flajolet, March 28 2013.
formula: a(n) = 2^n*binomial(n, [n/2]);G.f.: (sqrt((1+4*x)/(1-4*x))-1)/4/x. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 28 2003E.g.f.: BesselI(0, 4*x)+BesselI(1, 4*x). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 28 2003a(n)=4^n*sum{k=0..n, C(n,k)C(k)/(-2)^k}, with C(n)=A00108(n). - _Paul Barry_, Dec 28 2006(n+1)*a(n) -4*a(n-1) +16*(-n+1)*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 24 2012a(n) = (-4)^n*hypergeom([3/2,-n],[2],2). - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 26 2016
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 200, write("b060899.txt", n, " ", 2^n*binomial(n, n\2)); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 14 2009]
author: _David W. Wilson_, May 05 2001
